SourceProxy.name: CustomParticlePath

Documentation.long_help: Trace Particle Paths through time in a vector field.
Documentation.short_help: Trace Particle Paths through time in a vector field.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Particle Trace filter generates pathlines in a vector field from a collection of seed points. The vector field used is selected from the Vectors menu, so the input data set is required to have point-centered vectors. The Seed portion of the interface allows you to select whether the seed points for this integration lie in a point cloud or along a line. Depending on which is selected, the appropriate 3D widget (point or line widget) is displayed along with traditional user interface controls for positioning the point cloud or line within the data set. Instructions for using the 3D widgets and the corresponding manual controls can be found in section 7.4. This filter operates on any type of data set, provided it has point-centered vectors. The output is polygonal data containing polylines. This filter is available on the Toolbar.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: Specify which is the Input of the StreamTracer filter.

InputProperty.label: Seed Source
InputProperty.name: Source
InputProperty.Documentation: Specify the seed dataset. Typically fron where the vector field integration should begin. Usually a point/radius or a line with a given resolution.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: TerminationTime
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Setting TerminationTime to a positive value will cause particles to terminate when the time is reached. The units of time should be consistent with the primary time variable.

StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputVectors
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Specify which vector array should be used for the integration through that filter.

IntVectorProperty.name: ComputeVorticity
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Compute vorticity and angular rotation of particles as they progress

IntVectorProperty.name: DisableResetCache
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Prevents cache from getting reset so that new computation always start from previous results.
